thread.title: Elmo’s Ticklish Situation

author: Jason L. Riley
title: Elmo’s Ticklish Situation
text:
An academic paper published in June concluded that toddlers could learn as much from watching “Sesame Street” as they could from attending preschool—which might impress someone unfamiliar with how the products of America’s preschools have fared on Big Bird’s watch.
President Johnson signed the Public Broadcasting Act that created the Corporation for Public Broadcasting in 1967, and the first episode of “Sesame Street” aired two years later. Since then, federal education spending per pupil has nearly tripled (adjusting for... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
